headline: Tool Company Stanley Black & Decker's Q4 Earnings Win Overshadowed by Tariff Trouble - What's Going On?
summary: Stanley Black & Decker Inc. (NYSE:SWK) shares are trading lower after the company reported better-than-expected fourth-quarter results and provided 2025 guidance. Stanley Black & Decker reported a fourth-quarter sales decline of 0.43% year over year to $3.720 billion, beating the consensus estimate of $3.580 billion. Quarterly net sales remained flat, as volume growth (+4%) was offset by declines in price (-1%), currency (-1%), and the Infrastructure divestiture (-2%). Gross profit increased 3.6

Quarterly net sales remained flat, as volume growth (+4%) was offset by declines in price (-1%), currency (-1%), and the Infrastructure divestiture (-2%). Gross profit increased 3.6

headline: Stanley Black & Decker sees weak 2025 profit, prepares to blunt tariff impact
summary: (Reuters) -Stanley Black & Decker on Wednesday forecast annual profit below estimates, hurt by tepid demand for its power tools, and said it was preparing measures to mitigate a hit from the recent tariffs announced by U.S. President Donald Trump.  Shares of the company, which supplies to retailers as well as automotive and aerospace customers, were down 3.8% in early trading.  In the last few days, Trump has ordered sweeping tariffs against Mexico, Canada and China, but paused levies on the United States' two neighbours.

headline: Stanley Black & Decker’s (NYSE:SWK) Q4 Sales Beat Estimates
summary: Manufacturing company Stanley Black & Decker (NYSE:SWK) reported Q4 CY2024 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, but sales were flat year on year at $3.72 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.40 per share was 10.2% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
